titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Robert E. Cowart papers, 1908-1924
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, September 2018

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Letters from Thomas Taylor Munford discussing the battle of Five Forks (1865) and a letter on the presidential election of 1924. Munford discusses the roles of Fitzhugh Lee, Thomas Rosser, and George E. Pickett in that battle, as well as Philip Sheridan and Gouveneur Warren. The Munford letters are copies made presumably by Robert Cowart for Keith Reid of Savannah, Ga.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Robert E. Cowart Papers, 1908-1924, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, September 2018.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Letters from Thomas Taylor Munford discussing the battle of Five Forks (1865) and a letter on the presidential election of 1924. Munford discusses the roles of Fitzhugh Lee, Thomas Rosser, and George E. Pickett in that battle, as well as Philip Sheridan and Gouveneur Warren. The Munford letters are copies made presumably by Robert Cowart for Keith Reid of Savannah, Ga.
